recipes.name: Tex-Mex Mini Burgers
ingredients: 1 large Texas sweet onion, thinly sliced (reserve 1/8 cup for salsa)
1 tablespoon adobo sauce (from canned chipotle peppers in adobo)
1 lb ground beef (or 1 lb TVP for vegetarian option)
1-2 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, seeded and minced (plus 2 tablespoons adobo sauce)
5 ounces Monterey Jack cheese or queso blanco, finely diced
1 ounce light or fat-free sour cream (optional)
directions: Step 1: Caramelize the Onions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add sliced onions, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook until golden brown and caramelized (about 20 minutes), stirring occasionally. Season with salt, pepper, sugar, and adobo sauce. Set aside.

Step 2: Prepare the Tomato-Avocado Salsa: Combine diced tomato, avocado, lime juice, tequila, 1/8 cup reserved minced onion, and half of the chopped cilantro and parsley in a bowl. Chill until ready to serve.
Step 3: Preheat oven to 375°F.

Step 4: Combine the burger ingredients: In a large bowl, mix ground beef (or TVP), corn, minced chipotle peppers, remaining adobo sauce, minced garlic, cumin, Mexican oregano, and remaining cilantro and parsley.
Step 5: Form mini burgers: Shape the beef mixture into small patties (about 1 tablespoon each). Place on a baking sheet.
Step 6: Bake for 5-10 minutes, or until cooked through. Do not overcook.

Step 7: Assemble the mini burgers: Spread a small amount of refried beans on each tortilla chip. Top with a baked mini burger, some of the melted cheese, a dollop of sour cream (optional), caramelized onions, and tomato-avocado salsa.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a stack of three Tex-Mex mini burgers on a rustic wooden board, angled slightly to reveal the juicy patties and vibrant fillings.  Use soft, directional light to highlight the textures of the charred patties, caramelized onions, and creamy avocado. A shallow depth of field focuses on the middle burger. Garnish with a lime wedge and fresh cilantro sprig.  Incorporate a blurred background of colorful Mexican textiles and rustic pottery to create a warm, inviting mood.

scenes.voice_over: In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, corn, minced chipotle peppers, adobo sauce, minced garlic, cumin, Mexican oregano, and the remaining cilantro and parsley.

recipes.name: Juicy Air Fryer Cheeseburgers
ingredients: 0.75 cup shredded sharp cheddar cheese (optional, for mixing into patties)
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, shredded cheddar cheese (if using), Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder. Gently mix with your hands until just combined. Do not overmix.

Step 2: Divide the beef mixture into 4 equal portions (approximately 6 to 6.5 ounces each). Shape each portion into a patty about ¾-inch thick. Make a small indentation in the center of each patty with your thumb to prevent them from bulging during cooking.
Step 3: If not cooking immediately, arrange the patties on a baking sheet lined with wax paper or parchment paper. Refrigerate for up to 2 hours.
Step 4: Preheat the air fryer to 400°F (200°C).
Step 5: Place 2 patties (or 4 if your air fryer is large enough) in the air fryer basket, ensuring they are not overcrowded.
Step 6: Reduce the air fryer temperature to 375°F (190°C). Cook the burgers for 9 to 10 minutes, flipping them over after about 6 minutes.
Step 7: If desired, top each burger with a slice of cheese during the last 30 to 60 seconds of cooking time, or until the cheese is melted.
Step 8: Toast the buns, if desired.
Step 9: Assemble the burgers on the buns with your favorite toppings and sauces.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture juicy air fryer cheeseburgers with perfect grill marks, nestled in toasted buns.  Use a slightly overhead, angled shot with shallow depth of field, focusing on the melted cheese and glistening patty.  Incorporate rustic wood elements and dark backgrounds. Include crisp lettuce, red onion, and tomato slices.  Highlight the texture of the bun and cheese pulls with soft, directional lighting, creating a warm, inviting mood.

video_script.title: Juicy Air Fryer Cheeseburgers

scenes.voice_over: Craving a juicy, flavorful cheeseburger but short on time? Ditch the grill and fire up your air fryer! Today, we're making restaurant-quality cheeseburgers right at home, with minimal cleanup.

scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need for the patties: ground beef, preferably 80/20 lean, shredded cheddar cheese (optional, but adds great flavor!), Worcestershire sauce, kosher salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder.

scenes.image_prompt: A hand gently mixes the ground beef with seasonings and shredded cheddar cheese in a large bowl.
scenes.voice_over: In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, shredded cheddar, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder. Gently mix with your hands until just combined. Don't overmix, as this can make the burgers tough.

scenes.image_prompt: Four equally sized beef patties with a small indentation in the center of each, arranged on a plate ready for the air fryer.
scenes.voice_over: Divide the mixture into four equal portions and shape them into patties about 3/4-inch thick. Make a small indentation in the center to prevent them from bulging during cooking.

scenes.image_prompt: An air fryer basket with two burger patties inside, ready for cooking.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your air fryer to 400°F. Once hot, place the patties in the basket, making sure they aren't overcrowded.  Reduce the temperature to 375°F.  Cook for 9-10 minutes, flipping halfway through.

scenes.image_prompt: A close-up shot of a spatula flipping a burger patty in the air fryer basket. The patty is nicely browned.
scenes.voice_over: After about 6 minutes, carefully flip the patties.  They should be beautifully browned.

scenes.image_prompt: A slice of cheese being placed on top of a burger patty in the air fryer during the last minute of cooking.
scenes.voice_over: If you like, top each burger with a slice of cheese during the last 30-60 seconds, or until melted and gooey.

scenes.image_prompt: Toasted burger buns, burger patties with melted cheese, and a variety of toppings such as lettuce, tomato, onion, and pickles are displayed on a table.
scenes.voice_over: While the burgers cook, toast your buns. Once the patties are done, assemble your burgers with your favorite toppings.

scenes.image_prompt: Two completed air fryer cheeseburgers, served with french fries and a side of ketchup and mustard.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your juicy air fryer cheeseburgers immediately with fries, a side salad, or your favorite sides.  Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For best results, use ground beef with an 80/20 lean-to-fat ratio for juicy burgers.
Don't overmix the beef mixture, as this can result in tough burgers.
Making a small indentation in the center of each patty helps prevent them from bulging during cooking.
Preheat your air fryer for optimal cooking performance.
Adjust cooking time depending on your air fryer model and desired level of doneness.

recipes.name: Blue Cheese Burgers with Tomato-Shallot Jam
ingredients: French fries, for serving and topping
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Tomato-Shallot Jam: Halve the cherry tomatoes and toss them with the sugar in a bowl. Let them sit at room temperature for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.

Step 2: Cook the Tomato-Shallot Jam: Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the tomatoes, any accumulated juices, and the minced shallots. Cook, stirring frequently, for 12-15 minutes, until the jam thickens and the tomatoes break down.
Step 3: Finish the Jam: Stir in the lime juice, zest, and salt. Cook for 1-2 more minutes. Remove from heat, let cool, and store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 10 days.

Step 4: Prepare the Burgers: In a medium bowl, combine the ground beef, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Gently mix with your hands, avoiding overmixing. Form into 3-4 patties.

Step 5: Cook the Burgers: Preheat grill to high. Grill the patties for 4-5 minutes per side for desired doneness. During the last minute, top each patty with a slice of Castello Burger Blue cheese. Toast the hamburger buns on the grill if desired.
Step 6: Assemble the Burgers: Spread tomato-shallot jam on the bottom bun. Top with lettuce, burger patty, French fries, and the top bun. Serve immediately.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture two juicy blue cheese burgers, layered with vibrant tomato-shallot jam, on rustic wooden boards.  Use a slightly overhead, angled shot highlighting the melted blue cheese and jam dripping down the patty. Soft, diffused lighting should emphasize the textures.  Shallow depth of field, focusing on the foreground burger's cheese and jam, creates a mouthwatering mood.  Garnish with fresh thyme sprigs and a scattering of flaky sea salt.  Background should be dark and moody, complementing the rich colors of the dish.

scenes.text: Blue Cheese Burgers with Tomato-Shallot Jam
scenes.voice_over: Get ready to elevate your burger game! Today, we're making gourmet Blue Cheese Burgers featuring a homemade Tomato-Shallot Jam, crispy French fries, and creamy Castello Burger Blue cheese.

scenes.image_prompt: Show a table with all ingredients for the recipe neatly arranged. Group related ingredients together (e.g., jam ingredients, burger ingredients).
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need. For the jam: cherry tomatoes, sugar, shallots, lime, and salt. For the burgers: Ground beef, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, olive oil, salt, pepper, Castello Burger Blue cheese, hamburger buns, lettuce, and French fries.

scenes.image_prompt: Halved cherry tomatoes being tossed in sugar in a glass bowl. Focus on the tomatoes and sugar coating them.
scenes.voice_over: First, let's make the jam. Halve the cherry tomatoes and toss them with sugar in a bowl. Let them sit for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. This macerates the tomatoes and draws out their juices.

scenes.image_prompt: The tomato-shallot mixture cooking in a skillet over medium-high heat. The mixture should be bubbling and thickening.
scenes.voice_over: After an hour, transfer the tomatoes and accumulated juices to a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the minced shallots and cook for 12-15 minutes, stirring frequently, until the jam thickens.

scenes.image_prompt: Lime zest being grated into the tomato-shallot jam in the skillet. Focus on the zest falling into the jam.
scenes.voice_over: Stir in the lime juice, zest, and salt. Cook for 1-2 more minutes. Set aside to cool.

scenes.image_prompt: Ground beef being mixed with brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, olive oil, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Focus on the mixing process.
scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, combine the ground beef, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Gently mix, avoiding overmixing. Form into 3-4 patties.

scenes.image_prompt: Burger patties grilling on a hot grill. The patties should have grill marks and be slightly charred.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your grill to high. Grill the patties for 4-5 minutes per side for desired doneness. During the last minute, add the Castello Burger Blue cheese slices.

scenes.image_prompt: Burger bun being toasted on the grill. The bun should be lightly golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Toast the buns on the grill for a few seconds if desired.

scenes.image_prompt: A fully assembled blue cheese burger, cut in half to show the inside, with french fries on the side. The jam, lettuce, cheese, and burger patty should be clearly visible.
scenes.voice_over: Now, assemble your burger! Spread the tomato-shallot jam on the bottom bun, add lettuce, the burger patty, a generous pile of french fries, and the top bun. Serve immediately.

scenes.image_prompt: Final shot of the Blue Cheese Burger with fries, a cold drink, and napkins on a picnic table outdoors.
scenes.voice_over: These Blue Cheese Burgers are a true flavor explosion! Enjoy them with your favorite sides and cold drinks.  Each burger packs about 600-700 calories, with 30-40 grams of protein, carbs, and fat.

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use ground chuck or a blend of ground beef and sirloin.
If you don't have Castello Burger Blue, another creamy blue cheese will work.
Don't overcrowd the pan when making the tomato jam. Cook in batches if necessary.
Use a meat thermometer to ensure the burgers are cooked to your preferred internal temperature.

recipes.name: Classic Bison Burger
ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Gather all ingredients.

Step 2: Divide the ground bison into four equal portions (approximately 6 ounces each). Shape each portion into a patty slightly larger than the hamburger buns, creating a small indentation in the center of each patty with your thumb.
Step 3: Season both sides of the patties lightly with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Step 4: Heat the unsalted butter in a large, heavy skillet over medium to medium-low heat.
Step 5: Place one or two bison patties in the skillet and cook for 3 to 4 minutes per side. Do not flip the patties until the bottom releases easily from the pan.
Step 6: Continue cooking, flipping occasionally, until the internal temperature of the patties reaches 160°F (71°C) as measured with an instant-read thermometer. Repeat with the remaining patties.

Step 7: Assemble the burgers by placing the cooked bison patties on the hamburger buns. Add desired toppings such as cheese, tomatoes, red onion, lettuce, dill pickles, ketchup, mustard, mayonnaise, or burger sauce.
Step 8: Serve immediately and enjoy!
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a juicy bison burger, cooked medium-rare, on a rustic wooden board.  Focus on the glistening patty, textured bun, and melted cheese (if used). Use a shallow depth of field to highlight the burger's layers. Include fresh toppings like tomato, onion, and lettuce spilling out slightly. Backdrop should be dark and moody with warm, directional lighting creating highlights on the burger and toppings. Shoot from a slightly overhead angle, showcasing the burger's height and inviting texture. Garnish with a few scattered sesame seeds and a sprig of fresh parsley near the board.

recipes.name: Paleo Burger with Portobello Buns
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, combine the ground beef (or pork), egg, diced onion, chopped parsley, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Mix thoroughly until all ingredients are well incorporated.
Step 2: Form the mixture into burger patties. Approximately 2 tablespoons of the mixture should yield one large burger patty.
Step 3: Heat approximately 1 tablespoon of coconut oil or lard in a large frying pan over medium-high heat.

Step 4: Add the burger patties and bacon slices to the hot pan. Cook the burgers and bacon to your desired level of doneness. While the burgers and bacon are cooking, grill or pan-fry the portobello mushroom caps for about 5 minutes per side, or until tender.

Step 5: To assemble the burgers, place one grilled portobello mushroom cap gill-side down on a plate. Top with a handful of baby spinach, sliced avocado, the cooked burger patty, bacon slices, and finally the other portobello mushroom cap gill-side up.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture two stacked Paleo Burgers with Portobello buns on a rustic wooden board.  Focus on the juicy patty, crisp bacon, and vibrant avocado slices between the glistening Portobello caps.  Use a shallow depth of field to highlight the foreground burger, blurring the background burger and garnishes of red onion and parsley sprigs. Employ soft, natural lighting from the side to emphasize textures and create a warm, inviting mood.  Style with a linen napkin and vintage cutlery for a touch of elegance. Capture from a slightly elevated, three-quarters angle to showcase the burger's height and layers.

video_script.description: A delicious and healthy paleo burger recipe using portobello mushrooms as buns.

scenes.voice_over: Form the mixture into burger patties. About two tablespoons of mixture should make one large patty.

cooking_tips: For extra flavor, marinate the portobello mushroom caps in a mixture of olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and herbs before grilling.
If using ground pork, be sure to cook the burgers thoroughly to an internal temperature of 145°F (63°C).

recipes.name: Bastille Burger with Béarnaise, Blue Cheese, and Red Onion
ingredients: 2 hamburger buns or 4 slices French bread
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Grill: Heat your barbecue grill and allow the flames to die down to medium heat.

Step 2: Season and Shape the Patties: Season the ground beef generously with black pepper. Avoid adding salt at this stage, as it can toughen the meat. Gently form the beef into two equal-sized patties.

Step 3: Cook the Burgers: Grill the patties to your desired doneness, about 4-5 minutes per side for medium. During the last minute of cooking, place a slice of blue cheese on top of each patty to melt.
Step 4: Toast the Buns: While the burgers are cooking, toast the hamburger buns or French bread slices on the grill until lightly golden.
Step 5: Assemble the Burgers: Spread Béarnaise sauce on the bottom bun or bread slice. Top with lettuce, tomato slices, and the cooked burger with melted blue cheese.

Step 6: Add Remaining Toppings: Spread Dijon mustard on the top bun or bread slice. Place the sliced red onions and cornichons on top of the burger. Add an extra dollop of Béarnaise sauce, if desired. Close the burger with the top bun.
Step 7: Serve: Serve the burgers immediately while hot.

recipes.name: Spicy Chickpea and Veggie Burgers with Honey-Lime Slaw and Sriracha Mayo
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
1 jalapeño pepper, stemmed and deseeded (adjust to taste)
1-2 tablespoons chopped green onion (white and green parts)
1/2 tablespoon avocado oil, plus extra for cooking
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Sriracha Mayo: In a small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, 1 teaspoon lime juice, sriracha, and 1/8-1/4 teaspoon garlic powder. Set aside.

Step 2: Prepare the Honey-Lime Slaw: In a medium bowl, combine shredded cabbage, sliced jalapeño (if using), honey, 1/2 tablespoon avocado oil, the juice of 1 lime, and a pinch of salt. Toss to coat. Adjust lime juice and salt to taste. Set aside.
Step 3: Pulse Oats and Chickpeas: In a food processor, combine rolled oats and drained chickpeas. Pulse a few times until coarsely chopped, but not mushy.

Step 4: Sauté Vegetables: Heat 1/2 tablespoon avocado oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add diced bell pepper, stemmed and deseeded jalapeño, squeezed grated zucchini, and chopped green onion. Sauté until peppers are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Step 5: Season Vegetables: Season the sautéed vegetables with 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, red pepper flakes, dried oregano, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Step 6: Combine Mixture: Add the sautéed vegetables to the food processor with the oat and chickpea mixture. Add the egg.
Step 7: Form Patties: Pulse a few times to combine. Shape the mixture into four equal-sized balls. Flatten each ball into a patty about 1/2-inch thick.
Step 8: Chill (Optional): Cover and refrigerate the patties for at least 15-30 minutes to firm up. This step can be done overnight.
Step 9: Cook Burgers: Heat 1-2 tablespoons of avocado oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the burgers for 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown and heated through.

Step 10: Assemble Burgers: Spread sriracha mayo on the onion buns (or gluten-free alternative). Top with lettuce, a chickpea burger, and a generous serving of honey-lime slaw. Add fresh cilantro, if desired. Serve immediately.

Top with vibrant honey-lime slaw and a drizzle of sriracha mayo. Garnish with fresh cilantro sprigs. Use a dark, moody background with soft, directional lighting from the back left, highlighting the burger's texture and slaw's freshness. Shallow depth of field, focusing on the front halved burger, blurring the background. Capture a slightly overhead, ¾ angle to showcase both the burger's height and the slaw's vibrancy.

recipes.name: Korean Bulgogi Burgers
ingredients: 2 tbsp gochujang (Korean chili paste), plus extra for serving (optional)
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Bulgogi Marinade: In a bowl, whisk together the light soy sauce and soft light brown sugar until the sugar dissolves.

Step 2: Combine Burger Ingredients: Add the beef mince, breadcrumbs, crushed garlic, grated ginger, gochujang, and a generous grinding of black pepper to the bowl with the soy sauce mixture. Use your hands to thoroughly combine all ingredients.
Step 3: Shape and Chill Burger Patties: Divide the burger mixture into four equal portions. Shape each portion into a patty.  Chill the patties in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to firm up.

Step 4: Pickle the Cucumbers: In a small saucepan, combine the rice vinegar, caster sugar, ground turmeric, and a pinch of salt. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1 minute. Place the thinly sliced cucumbers in a bowl and pour the hot pickling liquid over them. Let the cucumbers pickle for at least 30 minutes, or until cool.

Step 5: Cook the Burgers: Rub each burger patty with 1 tsp of sunflower or vegetable oil. Heat a large, heavy-bottomed, non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Fry the burgers for 5-6 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
Step 6: Warm the Buns: While the burgers are cooking, warm the burger buns in a low oven.

Step 7: Assemble the Burgers: Split the warmed buns. Mix the mayonnaise with the toasted sesame oil and spread on both sides of each bun. Place a cooked burger patty on the bottom half of each bun. Top with pickled cucumber slices, shredded cabbage, and an extra smear of gochujang, if desired. Finish with a sprinkle of toasted sesame seeds and the top bun.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture two Korean Bulgogi Burgers on a dark wood cutting board, slightly angled.  Focus on the juicy bulgogi patty overflowing with vibrant pickled cucumber and shredded cabbage slaw.  Use a shallow depth of field to highlight the textures of the meat and slaw. Soft, directional light from the side should emphasize the glistening burger and create gentle shadows. Garnish with toasted sesame seeds and fresh cilantro sprigs. The background should be dark and moody with a hint of rustic texture. Style with a small bowl of extra slaw and chopsticks nearby.

recipes.name: Air Fryer Burgers
directions: Step 1: Preheat an air fryer to 350°F (175°C).
Step 2: In a mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, diced red onion, minced garlic, salt, pepper, Worcestershire sauce, and hot English mustard.
Step 3: Form the beef mixture into patties of your desired size, pressing a ball of the mixture with your hand and rounding the sides.

Step 4: Cook the patties in the preheated air fryer for about 10 minutes, or until they are firm and no longer pink in the centers. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160°F (70°C).

recipes.name: Epic Beef Burgers with Homemade Brioche Buns
ingredients: As needed Wine and garlic mushrooms, sautéed onions, cheddar cheese, mayonnaise, BBQ sauce, and arugula
directions: Step 1: Allow ground beef to rest outside the refrigerator for 15 minutes.
Step 2: In a large bowl, combine ground chuck, ground sirloin, paprika, thyme, and minced garlic.
Step 3: Wash hands with cold water. Quickly and gently mix the ground meat and spices, avoiding overmixing.
Step 4: Divide the meat mixture into four equal portions. Gently shape each portion into a burger patty, avoiding overhandling or pressing too firmly.
Step 5: Place the formed patties on a tray and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Step 6: Preheat grill to 500°F, maintaining one burner at a lower temperature than the others.
Step 7: Clean and oil the grill grates using a cloth and tongs.
Step 8: Remove the patties from the refrigerator.
Step 9: Season both sides of each patty with salt and pepper.
Step 10: Gently press the center of each patty with your thumb to create a slight indentation.
Step 11: Place the patties on the hot side of the grill, close the lid, and cook for 4 minutes without turning.
Step 12: Flip the patties, close the lid, and cook for another 4 minutes.
Step 13: Flip the patties once more and transfer them to the cooler side of the grill.
Step 14: Cook for an additional 3 minutes.
Step 15: Place the cooked patties on brioche buns.
Step 16: Top with desired toppings (wine and garlic mushrooms, sautéed onions, cheddar cheese, mayonnaise, BBQ sauce, and arugula) and enjoy.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture two epic beef burgers on homemade brioche buns, overflowing with wine and garlic mushrooms, sautéed onions, cheddar cheese, and arugula.  Use a slightly overhead, angled shot highlighting the juicy patties and melted cheese.  Dark wood background with a textured linen napkin.  Shallow depth of field, focusing on the burger's center.  Mood: Rustic, comforting, and indulgent.  Garnish with a few scattered thyme sprigs.  Lighting: Soft, natural light emphasizing texture and rich colors.

recipes.name: Smashed Burgers
ingredients: 4 slices mild cheddar or burger cheese
directions: Step 1: Slice the burger buns in half. Toast or grill the cut sides until lightly golden and set aside.
Step 2: Preheat oven to 100°C (80°C fan/gas ¼).
Step 3: Divide the mince into four equal portions. Season each portion generously with salt.
Step 4: Heat ½ tbsp sunflower oil in a heavy frying pan or skillet over high heat. Place one portion of seasoned mince in the hot pan.

Step 5: Quickly cover the mince with a square of baking parchment. Using a second smaller pan or a flat, heavy object (like a spatula or the bottom of a pot), press down firmly on the patty to flatten it thinly.
Step 6: Cook for 2 minutes.
Step 7: Remove the parchment paper and flip the patty. Press down again with a spatula.
Step 8: Top the patty with a slice of cheese and cook for 1 minute.
Step 9: Transfer the cooked burger to a baking tray and keep warm in the preheated oven while you repeat steps 4-8 with the remaining mince portions.

Step 10: To assemble each burger, place the bottom half of a toasted bun on a plate. Add shredded lettuce, sliced tomato, and red onion. Top with the smashed burger patty and gherkin slices. Cover with the top half of the bun.
Step 11: Serve immediately with mayonnaise, ketchup, and American mustard on the side.

scenes.voice_over: Welcome to my kitchen! Today, we're making smashed burgers—thin, crispy, and unbelievably juicy. These burgers are simple to make and guaranteed to impress.

directions: Step 1: Season the minced beef generously with salt and pepper. Divide the beef into 4 equal portions and shape each portion into a patty about 1.5cm thick.
Step 2: Heat a large, heavy pan over medium-high heat. Lightly spray the pan with oil.

Step 3: Once the pan is hot, add the burger patties and cook for 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare, or longer for desired doneness. For well-done burgers, ensure the internal temperature reaches 71°C (160°F).
Step 4: While the patties are cooking, lightly toast the cut sides of the burger buns in the same pan, taking care not to burn them.

Step 5: Assemble the burgers: Place the bottom bun on a plate, top with a slice of cheddar cheese, 3 tablespoons of coleslaw, the cooked beef patty, and 3 tablespoons of chili con carne. Finish with the top bun.

recipes.name: Southern Pimento Cheese Burger with Honey Slaw
ingredients: 1 cup extra-sharp cheddar cheese, shredded, room temperature
1/3 cup Monterey Jack cheese, shredded, room temperature
1 tablespoon bread and butter pickle juice
1/4 pound cured and smoked country ham, finely chopped
1/2 cup potato chips, crushed (preferably plain kettle-cooked)
directions: Step 1: Make the Pimento Cheese: In a medium mixing bowl, combine the cheddar cheese, Monterey Jack cheese, 3 tablespoons of mayonnaise, cream cheese, pimentos, pickle juice, horseradish sauce, and mustard. Mix until well combined.
Step 2: Make the Honey Slaw: In a small mixing bowl, combine the remaining 2 tablespoons of mayonnaise, honey, and cabbage. Mix until well combined.
Step 3: Cook the Bacon: Heat a 12-inch nonstick grill pan over medium-high heat. Add the bacon and cook until crispy, about 5 minutes per side, flipping once. Drain on paper towels.

Step 4: Prepare the Patties: Preheat oven to 375°F (for toasting buns). In a large bowl, combine the ground chuck, country ham, salt, and pepper. Gently mix, avoiding compacting the meat. Divide the mixture into 4 equal portions and form into patties to fit the buns. Make an indentation in the center of each patty.
Step 5: Cook the Patties: Using the same grill pan, cook the patties over medium-high heat for 3 minutes per side for medium-rare, or longer for desired doneness.
Step 6: Toast the Buns and Warm the Plates: While the patties cook, place the buns on a rack in the preheated oven and bake for 3-5 minutes. Place the serving plates in the oven to warm.

Step 7: Assemble the Burgers: Spread a generous amount of pimento cheese on the cut sides of the buns. On each bun bottom, place a thin layer of honey slaw. Top with a burger patty, 2 slices of bacon, and crushed potato chips. Add the top bun.
Step 8: Final Toast (Optional): Place the assembled burgers on a nonstick baking sheet and bake for 1 minute to melt the cheese and warm the ingredients thoroughly.
Step 9: Serve: Serve the burgers immediately on the warmed plates.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a Southern Pimento Cheese Burger with Honey Slaw, featuring vibrant pimento cheese melting over a juicy patty on a toasted brioche bun.  Honey slaw spills invitingly from the burger. Style with rustic wooden boards, checkered napkins, and a chilled glass of sweet tea.  Use soft, natural lighting to highlight the textures and vibrant colors.  Shallow depth of field, focused on the melting cheese and slaw, creates a warm, inviting mood. Shoot from a slightly overhead, three-quarters angle to showcase the burger's layers and overflowing slaw.

recipes.name: California Turkey Burgers
ingredients: Pinch of cayenne pepper or red pepper flakes
Fresh greens (such as spinach or arugula)
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Burger Patties: In a large bowl, combine the ground turkey, egg, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper (or red pepper flakes), 1/2 cup basil pesto, dried minced onion, and drained cottage cheese. Gently mix with your hands until just combined. Do not overmix. The mixture will be moist. Form the mixture into 8 equal-sized patties.

Step 2: Cook the Burgers: Heat 1 tablespoon of coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Once the oil is shimmering, add the turkey patties to the skillet, working in batches to avoid overcrowding. Cook for 4-6 minutes per side, or until the burgers are golden brown and cooked through. The internal temperature should reach 165°F (74°C).
Step 3: Make the Pesto Spread: In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise (or Greek yogurt) and 1 tablespoon of pesto. Mix well.

Step 4: Assemble the Burgers: Spread the pesto mixture on the bottom halves of the burger buns. Top with the cooked turkey patties, tomato slices, avocado slices, roasted red pepper strips, and fresh greens. Cover with the top halves of the buns and serve immediately.

A small bowl of basil pesto sits nearby, with a scattering of fresh basil leaves. Utilize soft, natural lighting from the side to highlight the burger's texture and the pesto's vibrant green. Shallow depth of field, focusing on the front burger, with a slightly blurred background of a linen napkin and checkered kitchen towel.  Aim for a bright, fresh, and inviting mood.

recipes.name: Turkey Burgers with Homemade Tzatziki

ingredients.item: salt and freshly ground black pepper
salt and freshly ground black pepper

directions: Step 1: Prepare the turkey burger mixture: Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Add the minced sweet onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes. Add the minced garlic and sauté for another minute until fragrant. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.

Step 2: Combine the burger ingredients: In a medium bowl, combine the cooled onion and garlic mixture with the egg, chopped parsley, dried oregano, red pepper flakes, and ground turkey. Add the bread crumbs and season with salt and pepper to taste. Mix thoroughly until all ingredients are well incorporated.

Step 3: Preheat and sear the burgers: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Form the turkey mixture into four equal-sized patties. Heat a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat and lightly coat with nonstick cooking spray. Sear the patties for 4-5 minutes per side, until well browned.
Step 4: Bake the burgers: Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15-17 minutes, or until the burgers are cooked through.

Step 5: Make the tzatziki sauce: While the burgers are baking, prepare the tzatziki sauce. In a medium bowl, combine the Greek yogurt, diced cucumber, 1 tablespoon of olive oil, lemon juice, and garlic powder. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the chopped parsley.

Step 6: Assemble the burgers: Place each cooked turkey burger on the bottom half of a whole-wheat hamburger bun. Top each burger with about ¼ cup of tzatziki sauce, two lettuce leaves, two tomato slices, and the top half of the bun. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Garlic Burgers with Creamy Sauce and Broccoli
directions: Step 1: Prepare the ingredients. Separate the eggs, trim the broccoli florets, dice the onion, and mince the garlic.
Step 2: In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, egg yolks, diced onion, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Gently mix until just combined. Form the mixture into 4 equal-sized patties.

Step 3: Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Once melted, add the burger patties and cook for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until browned and cooked through. Remove the patties from the skillet, set aside, and keep warm.

Step 4: Pour the heavy cream into the same skillet. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium and simmer for 5 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 5: While the sauce simmers, bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Add the broccoli florets and cook for 2-4 minutes, or until tender-crisp. Drain the broccoli and set aside.
Step 6: To serve, place each burger patty on a plate. Top with the creamy sauce and serve alongside the steamed broccoli.

recipes.name: Classic Butter Burgers
ingredients: 1 pound lean ground beef (90/10 or leaner), preferably sirloin
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, or to taste
1/4 teaspoon black pepper, or to taste
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Ingredients and Toast the Buns: Gather all ingredients. Lightly butter the cut sides of the hamburger buns. Toast the buns on a griddle, skillet, grill, or under the broiler until lightly golden. Set aside.

Step 2: Sauté the Onions: In a large skillet over medium heat, melt 2 tablespoons of butter. Add the chopped onions and cook, stirring frequently, until softened and lightly browned, about 15 minutes. Remove the onions from the skillet and set aside.
Step 3: Form the Burger Patties: Shape the ground beef into four equal patties. Make a small indentation in the center of each patty to prevent them from bulging during cooking.

Step 4: Cook the Burgers: Place the same skillet back over medium heat. Add the burger patties and season with kosher salt and black pepper. Cook for 6-8 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches at least 160°F (71°C).
Step 5: Melt the Cheese: Top each burger patty with a slice of American cheese. Continue cooking until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Step 6: Reheat Onions and Assemble the Burgers: While the cheese melts, reheat the sautéed onions.  Generously butter the top halves of the toasted buns (approximately 2 tablespoons each).  If desired, add lettuce leaves to the bottom buns. Place the cooked cheeseburgers on top of the lettuce. Top each burger with a heaping spoonful of the reheated onions and cover with the buttered top bun.
Step 7: Serve: Serve the butter burgers immediately and enjoy!
recipes.image_prompt: Capture four juicy butter burgers on a rustic wooden board, slightly angled.  Soft, directional light from the side highlights the glistening melted cheese and textured buns. Shallow depth of field focuses on the burger closest to the camera, blurring the background elements: chopped onions, a pat of butter, and crisp lettuce leaves.  The mood is warm and inviting, emphasizing the rich, savory flavors.  Use a dark, slightly textured background for contrast.

recipes.name: Bacon Cheeseburger
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). If using fresh buns, skip to step 2.
Step 2: Lightly toast the burger buns in the preheated oven for 3-5 minutes. Remove and set aside.
Step 3: In a bowl, combine the minced beef, paprika, cumin, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper. Gently mix and form into two equal patties.
Step 4: Cook the bacon in a pan over medium heat until crispy. Remove from pan and set aside, reserving the bacon grease if desired.

Step 5: In the same pan, cook the beef patties to your desired doneness, about 4-5 minutes per side for medium. During the last minute of cooking, place a slice of cheddar cheese on each patty and cover the pan to melt the cheese.
Step 6: While the burgers are cooking, slice the tomato and pickles.
Step 7: In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise and mustard to make the sauce.

Step 8: Assemble the burgers: Spread the mayonnaise-mustard sauce on both halves of the toasted buns. On the bottom bun, layer lettuce, tomato slices, the cooked burger patty with melted cheese, bacon, and pickle slices. Top with the other bun half.

recipes.name: Indo-Chinese Vegetarian Burgers
ingredients: 2 medium Potatoes, boiled, peeled, and mashed or grated
1 small Green Bell Pepper, finely chopped
1/2 cup Spring Onions, white and green parts, chopped
1/2 cup Soy Granules (TVP), soaked in hot water for 10 minutes, then squeezed dry
2 tablespoons All-Purpose Flour, whisked with 2 tablespoons water
4 Whole Wheat Burger Buns, lightly toasted
directions: Step 1: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a pan. Add chopped spring onions, ginger, and garlic. Cook for 1-2 minutes.
Step 2: Add carrots, green beans, and green bell pepper. Cook on medium heat until tender, about 6-8 minutes.
Step 3: Stir in 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1-2 teaspoons chili-garlic sauce, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Step 4: Add mashed or grated potatoes and drained soy granules. Cook for 3-4 minutes. Let the mixture cool slightly.
Step 5: Divide the mixture into 4 portions. Form each portion into a patty, pressing gently to hold its shape.
Step 6: Prepare a shallow plate with the flour-water mixture and another with bread crumbs. Dip each patty in the flour mixture, then coat with bread crumbs.
Step 7: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook the patties for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through. Do not flip too soon to prevent breakage.
Step 8: For the chili spread, combine 1/4 cup chili garlic sauce, 2 teaspoons ketchup, 1 teaspoon rice vinegar, 1 teaspoon agave nectar, and 2 teaspoons soy sauce in a bowl.
Step 9: Spread the chili spread on both sides of the burger buns. Layer lettuce, sprouts, burger patty, and optional chopped spring onions on the bottom bun. Top with the other bun and serve.

Shallow depth of field, focusing on the cut patty. Backdrop of dark slate with soft, directional light highlighting the golden crust and vibrant vegetables. Garnish with chopped spring onions and a smear of chili garlic sauce. Style with chopsticks and a small bowl of soy sauce for dipping. Moody, inviting atmosphere.

recipes.name: Chicken Parmesan Burgers with Grilled Vegetables
ingredients: 1/3 cup Red bell pepper, minced (about 1/2 medium)
Freshly ground Black pepper, to taste
1 small (or 1/2 large) Summer squash, sliced into 1/2-inch planks
4 oz Fresh part-skim mozzarella cheese, sliced into 4 rounds
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Chicken Burgers: In a mixing bowl, combine ground chicken, minced garlic, minced red bell pepper, grated Parmesan cheese, salt, dried oregano, and black pepper. Mix thoroughly until well combined. Form the mixture into four evenly sized patties, approximately 1-inch thick. Cover and refrigerate until ready to cook.

Step 2: Make the Fire-Roasted Tomato Sauce: Heat 1 teaspoon of olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the minced onion and garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes, until softened and fragrant. Add the fire-roasted tomatoes, kosher salt, oregano, and red pepper flakes. Simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat, cool slightly, then puree in a blender until smooth. Return the sauce to the pan and keep warm.

Step 3: Grill the Vegetables: Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium heat. Toss the zucchini, summer squash, and eggplant slices with 2 tablespoons of olive oil, kosher salt, and white pepper. Grill the zucchini and summer squash for 3-4 minutes per side, and the eggplant for 6-8 minutes per side, until tender. Remove from grill, cover loosely with foil, and set aside.
Step 4: Cook the Chicken Burgers: Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook the chicken burgers for about 6 minutes per side, or until cooked through.

Step 5: Assemble and Broil: Preheat the broiler to high. Transfer the cooked burgers to a foil-lined baking sheet. Top each burger with a generous amount of fire-roasted tomato sauce and a slice of mozzarella cheese. Broil for 1-2 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Step 6: Serve: Place each chicken parmesan burger on a bun and top with the grilled vegetables.

Alongside, artfully arrange grilled zucchini, bell peppers, and red onion. Utilize a slightly overhead, 45-degree angle with a shallow depth of field, focusing on the burger's textures. Soft, natural lighting should highlight the golden crust and vibrant colors.  A rustic wooden backdrop and scattered Parmesan shavings complete the scene, creating a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: The Ultimate Grilled Chicken Burger
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Burger Sauce: In a small bowl, combine 1 cup mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, 2 teaspoons lemon juice, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Mix well and set aside.
Step 2: Preheat the Grill: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Step 3: Prepare Ingredients and Toppings: Chop chives and oregano. Slice tomato, avocado, and red onion.

Step 4: Prepare the Chicken Patties: In a large bowl, combine ground chicken, minced garlic, chopped chives, chopped oregano, juice of 1/2 lemon, breadcrumbs, 2 tablespoons of mayonnaise, salt, and pepper. Gently mix with your hands until just combined. Do not overmix.
Step 5: Shape the Patties: Form the chicken mixture into 6 equal-sized patties. Create a small indentation in the center of each patty to prevent bulging during cooking.
Step 6: Grill the Patties: Place the patties on the preheated grill. Cook for 5-7 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Step 7: Toast the Buns (Optional): While the patties are cooking, toast the hamburger buns on the grill for 30 seconds per side, if desired.

Step 8: Assemble the Burgers: Spread the prepared burger sauce on both halves of each bun. Place the cooked chicken patties on the bottom buns, and top with lettuce, tomato, avocado, and red onion slices. Cover with the top buns and serve immediately.

scenes.voice_over: Combine the ground chicken, minced garlic, chopped chives, chopped oregano, lemon juice, breadcrumbs, mayonnaise, salt, and pepper. Mix gently until just combined. Don't overmix!

scenes.image_prompt: Hands shaping chicken patties into even sizes with an indentation in the center.
scenes.voice_over: Divide the mixture into six equal portions and shape them into patties. Make a small indent in the center to prevent them from bulging during grilling.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken patties grilling on a preheated grill, flames visible in background.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your grill to medium-high heat. Grill the patties for 5-7 minutes per side, or until they reach an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).

scenes.image_prompt: Burger buns toasting lightly on the edges of the grill.
scenes.voice_over: While the patties are grilling, you can lightly toast your buns for added flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Assembling the burger: sauce on bun, chicken patty, lettuce, tomato, avocado, and red onion slices.
scenes.voice_over: Now, let's build! Spread the burger sauce on both halves of the bun. Add the grilled chicken patty, followed by lettuce, tomato, avocado, and red onion.

scenes.image_prompt: Two finished grilled chicken burgers, plated and ready to serve, with a side of extra sauce.
scenes.voice_over: These delicious and healthy grilled chicken burgers are around 500-600 calories per serving, with 35-40 grams of protein. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: To ensure even cooking, make a small indentation in the center of each patty before grilling.
For a richer flavor, use ground chicken thighs instead of chicken breasts.
If you don't have a grill, you can cook the patties in a skillet over medium-high heat.
